intro: Brandesia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf brandesia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas. Brandesia lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
